description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE DEMOLITION OF EXISTING REAR EXTENSION AND ERECTION OF NEW SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION, ERECTION OF A REAR ROOF DORMER WITH JULIETTE BALCONY INVOLVING REMOVAL OF CHIMNEY, AND INSERTION OF 3X ROOFLIGHTS TO THE FRONT SLOPE.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations comprising the erection of a single storey rear extension would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class A of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class A. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operations comprising the erection of a rear roof dormer with Juliette balcony would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The operations comprising the insertion of 3 rooflights on the front roof slope would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 4 - The operations would consist of the removal of the rear chimney stack which would fall within the meaning of Class G of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in Class G. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.
